content:
On the Calendar tab, Events & Tasks, check Tasks (Alt+4) to show the search bar. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with Events & Tasks is hidden.

In simple terms, I think of events as having a defined start and end time, whereas tasks do not. Scheduled meetings are obviously events, while 'fix my computer' is a task.

creator: katia.buccella

content:
katia.buccella ha detto
(...) gli indirizzi email fanno capo all'Università di Pisa

Scusami, pensavo ti riferissi ad un account più comune. In questo caso non mi è possibile fare delle prove. Con vari account generici (Libero, Yahoo, ed altri) personalmente non riesco a riprodurre il problema.

Ho fatto una breve ricerca nel database di Bugzilla (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/) ma non mi pare ci siano altre segnalazioni analoghe.

D'altro canto se il problema viene registrato da più utenti ed è emerso solo dopo l'aggiornamento alla versione 115, è possibile che sia un bug. Potrebbe essere utile se apriste una segnalazione di bug su Bugzilla, aggiungendo le informazioni di cui disponente ed eventualmente qualche screenshot.

Esiste anche la possibilità di tornare alla versione precedente di Thunderbird, ma è una extrema ratio che in genere non consiglio -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1428585#answer-1613232

Come soluzione tampone, posso suggerire di creare una etichetta colorata e marcare manualmente i messaggi a cui si è risposto (https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-etichette-messaggi). Anche se intuisco sia comunque scomodo e poco funzionale.

content:
What information a DSN request returns is up to the receiving server. Most are simply turned off due to the servers being flagged as spammer for contributing backscatter with their DSN's

If you expect media outlets to have DSN enabled you will most likely be very disappointed. It would be one of the things they would disable as part of protecting their sources.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
bischoff.gilles said
Hello, I'm on thunderbird beta by chance (bad download, handling error) and I'd like to either go back to thunderbird release or have thunderbird beta in French because I don't know English or computers at all. Can you please solve my problem. Thank you for your help. Thank you. Gilles

The installer for the latest 120beta in French is here:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/120.0b5/win64/fr/

Downgrading to the 115 release is a bit more involved, but it is available in French:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.4.2/win64/fr/

I don't recommend this unless you first read about downgrading on this forum.

content: Thanks Matt. Looks like gone aawy. Just curious: If I were to restore a Profiles backup for some other reason, would the remnants of the bygone accout turn up again or maybe crash the Restore?
creator: peetrobo

content: Profile backups contain all the accounts that were active at the time. So, if you restore an old profile, those accounts will be restored as well. Their existence would not crash the restore, unless the profile itself was corrupted.

content:
First, I think the View menu on hamburger menu is not as complete as the one from menu bar and suggest using that one to select the sort option. Just press the Alt key for the menu bar to appear. Second, here are steps to fully reset the threading default: This is the official (to my knowledge) documentation. Well worth the read https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

Here is my own documentation on threading, duplicating the above, but it may help: You need to highlight each folder and click View>sort by>unthreaded. If this applies to just a few folders, just repeat the process as necessary. If you have many folders or plan to add many new folders, you may wish a different approach, below:

More info: To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags 0=unthreaded

Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right. 

 ------------

To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: (I creates a crude video that walks through the steps at 

   https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4  that demonstrates the following steps: 
   First, highlight a folder that you have set to unthreaded	    In the Message List view, in the column header, on the far right, open the options button that shows         context menu. :    At the very bottom is the option:    -> "Apply current view to..."    -> "Folder and its children..."    -> Hover over an account    -> In the next menu don't select a folder. Instead select the account name itself.
creator: davidsk

content: New events are added to whichever calendar is currently selected in the list in the left pane of the Calendar tab. Adding to other calendars can be done by clicking the drop-down menu in the Event window. So if you always want to add events to 666jjv, keep it selected in the calendar list.

content: If you still have access to the old profile, look in the Mail\Local Folders folder. Most files will be in two names, such as FILE and FILE.mpx. Copy both of those to the Mail\Local Folders folder of the active profile and restart Thunderbird and it should see them there.

content:
Try your test in safe/troubleshoot mode (Help/Troubleshoot Mode...), and if it still doesn't work, try it in a new profile (Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles). The current profile isn't affected.

This is the best way to confirm or refute the existence of a bug in TB.

content: If your message list pane is in 'table view' (one line per email), just click the DATE item on menu bar to change sort order. If you see more than one line per message, click the icon to the right of "Quick Filter" just above the message list pane and select 'table view' as you can then change sort order. On your other comment, remember that 'smart' doesn't mean 'wise.' :)

content:
Enable the Folder Pane Header under View/Folders, then right-click the cloud icon on the header to choose which account to download. Also, F5 gets mail for the current account, Shift+F5 gets mail for all accounts.

Alt-1 is the shortcut to bring the mail window into focus (Alt-2 for Address Book, Alt-3 for Calendar etc.).

content:
I think I may have solved* the problem. I went into File > Get New Messages for > and the account was listed there... When I selected it TB DID now ask me for the Password and when I entered it (and ticked the "Store" it in Saved Passwords box), TB fetched the unread mails from the server and the account now appears in the Saved Passwords list with a pop3 entry too! TB now seems to be checking that server again now too when I click the "Get Messages" button. (However, this does seem to indicate some kind of flaw in the program that the Developers might wish to address here?)

Edit: *"solved" was the wrong choice of word here, I should have said "fixed" or "sorted" as I still have absolutely no idea of why TB was behaving in this fashion! If anyone can explain it (or, even better, fix the program's code) then it might be a good idea to post an explanation in this thread for the benefit of future inquirers.

It would appear that, in the first instance, TB just lost the entry (in Saved Passwords) for what was my Default Account so (completely unknown to me, for some considerable time) I wasn't getting any of my mail to that account downloaded by TB.

My "fix" (above) seems to have sorted the problem but surely TB should ASK me for a password (if it's missing) when downloading messages from all accounts rather than just 'ignoring' that account and pressing on with the rest?

That definitely seems to me like a bug in the code that needs addressing in the next update?
creator: wb.cameron
